title: Admissions Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Heritage College & Institute in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: Met with head of school and they ran me through the job process but didn't disclose it was a sales job, I thought I'd be helping people not trying to sell a fake college.
Interview Questions: What is a difficult situation you had to deal with at work and how did you resolve it?

title: Admissions Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Heritage College & Institute in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: It took multiple interviews for the offer. But it was smooth. People were nice, atmosphere was nice too. Need to dress in slacks and nice shirts. Khakis not appropriate. Interview went by fairly quick and painless.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: Admissions Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Heritage College & Institute (Oklahoma City, OK) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was a long process. I Had to interview with Campus Director, regional, and national director. It seemed to be a panel decision on hiring and interviewing with 3 different people, 2 of which I only interviewed with over the telephone.
Interview Questions: What are your goals, if hired?

title: Director of Career Services Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Heritage College & Institute
Interview Descriptions: Met with Campus President, had a nice interview. Received a call from Regional Director to call her back to chat. Never received a call back from her, called Campus President he said that the Regional Director was sick and would call me back by the end of week. No phone call from the Regional or Campus President. I wasn't notified that they filled the position. Not very professional.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Career Services Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Heritage College & Institute in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Met with Director of Career Services and Campus President. Then did a phone interview with Vice President of Career Services.  They were all very open about School and easy to interview with. Pretty smooth process. Became more interested after speaking with each of them.
Interview Questions: How would you open up employer doors for students

title: Personal Fitness Training Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Heritage College & Institute (Columbus, OH) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview was conducted in a classroom with staff as an audience. I had to do a mock presentation and display my teaching skills. The follow up was late. I did not hear back from the job until about 3 months later. I eventually got the job. The interview included a group/panel. The career services manager, the director of education, and the lead instructor for the program.
Interview Questions:
Where did you last work?
What is your teaching experience?

title: Medical Assisting Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Heritage College & Institute
Interview Descriptions: Great place to work it would seem. Staff is friendly and helpful and very welcoming. Course of study options seem to meet the community needs. I enjoyed meeting and speaking with everyone at this location.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Heritage College & Institute
Interview Descriptions: Very professional process.  First you meet with the person who will be your direct supervisor.  Pending what position you are trying to get, your next and last interview is with the manager and director.
Interview Questions: Nothing that I can remember.  All questions were typical.

title: Admissions Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Heritage College & Institute (Kansas City, MO)
Interview Descriptions: Did 1on 1 interview then had phone interview with home office.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Heritage College & Institute (Denver, CO) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: Was interviewed by the campus director of education and then called again to interview with leader of Academics for Heritage College. The process took longer than usual because of vacation time that the campus president was on. Once everyone was available to meet, the process moved quickly.
Interview Questions: How do you identify at risk students and coach them to succeed?

title: Admissions Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Heritage College & Institute (Little Rock, AR) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview, in person with direct supervisor, then another in person interview with school director, last interview was with national admissions director. It was very intensive and intimidating. They definitely want to make sure they get the right person for the job. The job isn't for everyone and they don't want to put the wrong person in the job.
Interview Questions: How are you in a team environment?

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Heritage College & Institute (Wichita, KS) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: Prepared a class room topic and presented it to fellow instructors from different departments.  Was then asked how I would handle situations that arose with students and asked about different teaching styles
Interview Questions: How will address issues with students that are disruptive

title: Admissions Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Heritage College & Institute (Wichita, KS) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: Applied in January, got an email in February - I responded but never heard a reply until a phone call from the same person in July asking if I was interested.  I got another call in August with a voicemail asking if I was interested in the position - it was clear to me that she didn't realize I was the same person she's called three times already.  I called and left a voicemail again and no response so I called again later in the day and was able to get a hold of her to set up the interview.  An hour later she called me back and asked if I was still interested in the position she had just gotten my voicemail?!?!
Interview Questions: I showed up to the interview with my resume as requested and the front desk rep took our resumes back to our interviewee.  It ended up being a group interview which wasn't mentioned) and the manager explained the position to us.  She then asked us to explain our previous experience (wasn't that what the resume was for) and then said she would be in contact with us.  Didn't ask us anything else.  I have called and sent e-mails and still haven't heard whether the position is still open.  Today I go online and the position is posted YET again.

title: Admissions Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Heritage College & Institute (Little Rock, AR) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: It was a phone screening first. Then an in person interview one on one. Then an interview with the school director. We then took a tour of the school, after that I received a phone offer and then we chose a date when I would start work.
Interview Questions: If a single mother told you she couldn't go to school because she had children to take care of and her husband didn't want to watch the kids, what would you say?

title: Administration Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Heritage College & Institute
Interview Descriptions: I had two interviews. Both were very simple. I don't think there were any other candidates. I was hired on the spot and I DID NOT undergo a background or drug test which is weird since I was going to be around social security numbers all day. No negotiating for pay.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you had to deal with a difficult customer

title: Director of Admission Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Heritage College & Institute (Denver, CO) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: First there was a phone screen.  Then a face to face interview at the campus.  Then they flew me to Denver, CO and I interviewed in front of a panel.  The called me with a job offer the next day.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about your work history.
Do you feel comfortable asking tough questions to people?  Give an example

title: X-ray Tech Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Heritage College & Institute (Columbus, OH) in Nov 2011
Interview Descriptions: This place had me do 3 interviews and on my final interview which was with the director told me that she was going to call my references and then offer me the position. I never got a call back, I made numerous phone calls to the director and left voice mails expressing my interest yet in the position and when I never heard back, I emailed her. Never got a response, the least they could of done was said thanks, but no thanks. Needless to say, I also asked my references if they were ever called and they were not. I would not want to be a student at this college, the way they gave  me the silent treatment, they would probably do the same to the students. So if anyone is thinking about applying for a position at this place, I would not do it! I lived in Dayton and had to travel 3 times to the Columbus campus and they knew that. I was looking to move to the area once I would had started working there. All for nothing and just a drained gas tank and missed work at my current employer. Very unprofessional!
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Admissions Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Heritage College & Institute (Fort Myers, FL) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: The Admissions Department is looking for anyone with a background in sales (some exceptions) and individuals who like sticking to scripts and not being creative.
Interview Questions: What would you say to a student who enrolled in classes but then was afraid to begin because they didn't want to take out student loans?

title: Medical Assisting Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Heritage College & Institute (Jacksonville, FL) in Oct 2010
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with the Program Director. Was asked to return for a sample teach session. Offer letter was sent the next day.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Admissions Associtae Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Heritage College & Institute (Jacksonville, FL) in May 2009
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and was then contacted for an interview. I arrived 30 minutes early and was instructed to fill out an application. After I was finished filling out my application, I waited another 30 minutes before I was even acknowledged. To my surprise, when I was finally called to the back, they instructed another young woman to come along with me. The manager interviewed us together and it was not supposed to be a group interview. Very unprofessional in my opionion.
Interview Questions: If you were giving a tour, and over heard another student talking bad about their instructor, what would you do?
